question.text: During the propagation of a nerve impulse, the action potential results from the movement of

options.text: K<sup>+</sup> ions from extracellular fluid to intracellular fluid
Na<sup>+</sup> ions from extracellular fluid to intracellular fluid
K<sup>+</sup> ions from intracellular fluid to extracellular fluid
Na<sup>+</sup> ions from intracellular fluid to extracellular fluid

solution.text: The total sum of physio-electrochemical changes that takes place along the length of the nerve fibre is known as nerve impulse. Change in potential due to the stimulation of nerve fibre is called an action potential. During propagation of nerve impulse, Na<sup>+</sup> enters inside so (+ve) charge is formed inside the membrane. K<sup>+</sup> ions come out.
